Key Match Events: Uruguay beat Canada on penalties to take third place in the Copa America
Federico Valverde, Rodrigo Bentancur, Giorgian de Arrascaeta, and Luis Suarez all converted their penalties for Uruguay
Ismael Kone and Alphonso Davies missed their penalties for Canada
Pre-Game Insights: Canada made their Copa America debut in the match
Post-Match Reflections: Jesse Marsch hailed his Canada side's potential as they build to the 2026 World Cup
Marcelo Bielsa thought his side's performance should have been better but was grateful for a victory after the disheartening semi-final loss to Colombia
Others: The match was played at the Bank of America Stadium in Charlotte, North Carolina
Jonathan David, Moise Bombito, and Mathieu Choiniere scored their spot kicks for Canada
Suarez scored a last-gasp goal in the 92nd minute to equalise for Uruguay and send the game straight to penalties
Rodrigo Bentancur opened the scoring early in the first half for Uruguay
Kone leveled the score with a sweetly-struck bicycle kick 14 minutes later for Canada
